pull_requests.title: BIP111: update status from Proposed to Final
pull_requests.body: The `NODE_BLOOM` service bit has been deployed in Bitcoin Core since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6579.

comment_list.body: Is there a Rescinded status given that its now off-by-default and really shouldn't be used?

Obsolete makes sense to me. The replacement for bloom filters is compact block
filters, which does ~everything they did but better.

Thanks all for the feedback.

- Bitcoin Core still has support for BIPs 37 and 111 (e.g., via the `-peerbloomfilters` config option) and both BIPs are currently listed as implemented in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8ee8a951c205c5365f7557253b8fffc12e6e670c/doc/bips.md.

- Many bitcoind nodes still signal `NODE_BLOOM`.

- BIP 37 has Final status.

Given these, (for now) it seems that BIP111 should be Final.

At some point, perhaps when support is removed, they can be marked as Replaced or Obsolete and the BIP 152 header updated to indicate that it replaces them.

pull_requests.title: BIP328: Use Base58Check in ExtendedKey.deserialize and validate length
pull_requests.body:
- Replace raw Base58 decode and manual slice with base58.decode_check(xpub) to enforce checksum validation as required by BIP-32 and as implied by the method docstring.
- Add strict len(data) == 78 check before parsing to ensure the serialized extended key length matches the BIP-32 78-byte structure.
- This prevents accepting corrupted or truncated extended keys and aligns deserialization behavior with Base58Check semantics.
